comments.body: it is crazy that we put these things in here instead of in the build system (not asking for a change, just complaining)
having `/apis` as default would be cleaner I assume.
I think defaulting to "" is better. We need to distinguish if "/apis" is user specified or if it's the default. It matters because we need to treat the "core" group specially in the latter case.
true, I guess with the ugly "core" special case we have to support there is no clean solution. I am fine with keeping `""` as default.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +50,54 @@	basePath               = flag.String("input-base", "k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/apis", "base path to look for the api group. Default to \"k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/apis\"")
	clientsetName          = flag.StringP("clientset-name", "n", "internalclientset", "the name of the generated clientset package.")
	clientsetAPIPath       = flag.StringP("clientset-api-path", "", "", "the value of default API path.")
	clientsetPath          = flag.String("clientset-path", "k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/client/clientset_generated/", "the generated clientset will be output to <clientset-path>/<clientset-name>. Default to \"k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/client/clientset_generated/\"")
	clientsetOnly          = flag.Bool("clientset-only", false, "when set, client-gen only generates the clientset shell, without generating the individual typed clients")

comments.body: Do you know why ugorji is picky on the folder name?

"testdata" is a magic word to Go, and any dir named "testdata" is ignored
by the tools.  Apparently this includes not looking at vendor/ dirs.
 ugorji calls `go run` on a file in this dir, thus it fails to compile.

On Thu, May 5, 2016 at 11:20 PM, Chao Xu notifications@github.com wrote:

> In cmd/libs/go2idl/client-gen/main.go
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/24242#discussion_r62292673
> :
> 
> > @@ -105,12 +106,12 @@ func main() {
> > 
> > ```
> > if *test {
> >     arguments.InputDirs = append(dependencies, []string{
> > ```
> > -           "k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/libs/go2idl/client-gen/testdata/apis/testgroup.k8s.io",
> > -           "k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/libs/go2idl/client-gen/test_apis/testgroup.k8s.io",
> 
> Do you know why ugorji is picky on the folder name?
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/24242/files/9bd7abdc6eff192782c250b5dcfbe486eeabc471..b2a5b40281484bef68f78271d744be7efeae9638#r62292673
Cool! Thanks for investigating it.
Is the purpose of this function parsing the base directory of types.go?
If so, could you make `const base = "k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg"` another input parameter?

yes, it gets the base directory from --input parameter (e.g. --input="../../federation/apis/federation/" will extract "../../federation/apis" and append it upon "k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/apis" which will resolve "k8s.io/kubernetes/federation/apis"

do you mean that using `--base="federation/apis/" --input="federation/"` and `--base=pkg/apis (default value) --input=extensions/` for k8s?

> do you mean that using --base="federation/apis/" --input="federation/" and --base=pkg/apis (default value) --input=extensions/ for k8s?

Yes. Actually I'd like to make  --base="k8s.io/kubernetes/federation/apis/", because I imagine the user may use this tool in other repositories as well. What do you think?

On second thought, this is how I envision a user will use client-gen:

```
./client-gen --input="pkg/federations/apis/fedatration/, pkg/apis/extensions/, pkg/api/" --clientset-path=... --clientset-name=...
```

And client-gen would parse the group and version from the full path. What do you think?

it should work right now, except that the base path is "k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/apis/" so inputs should be "../../federation/apis/federation/,extensions/,api/".
do you want to change the default base to "k8s.io/kubernetes/"?

You are right, it should work right now.

How about changing the base to ""k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg"? So you don't need the ".." in versionToPath.

The code in versionToPath doesn't matter.
How do you want the user to specify the input?
--input="pkg/apis/extensions/" or "apis/extensions/" or "extensions/", etc.
I see. I think --input="extensions/" is desirable.
What if the defaults change?
Then the hack/verify-codegen.sh will report the file needs to be regenerated.
shouldnt the default value include `extensions/v1beta1` instead of just `extensions`?
We are generating a clientset for the unversioned types right now, because all the user of the client package is using an unversioned one.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@var (
	test          = flag.BoolP("test", "t", false, "set this flag to generate the client code for the testdata")
	inputVersions = flag.StringSlice("input", []string{"api/", "extensions/"}, "group/versions that client-gen will generate clients for. At most one version per group is allowed. Specified in the format \"group1/version1,group2/version2...\". Default to \"api/,extensions\"")
	clientsetName = flag.StringP("clientset-name", "n", "release_1_1", "the name of the generated clientset package.")
	clientsetPath = flag.String("clientset-path", "k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/client/clientset_generated/", "the generated clientset will be output to <clientset-path>/<clientset-name>. Default to \"k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/client/clientset_generated/\"")

comments.body: Why do you need latest?
Because I want the framework to automatically import the latest package as necessary. See here: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/17699#discussion_r45954503.
I think this is the missing question you referred to?
Change InputDirs according to @wojtek-t's comment
